TopicTitle: Gravimetric scan contracts in flight are not possible?

Articles.Content:
I'm only putting this up here in modded because I do run a load of mods, but this is some part of the base game that's proving... tricky. I also haven't seen any other threads on this, so if there are, point me to 'em!

Anyway, I've accepted a couple of contracts requiring me to perform gravimetric scans of some localities around Kerbin, all above a certain altitude, the lowest of which is around 17,300m. However, upon flying to the first of these scan sites, I was met with an age-old message when trying to scan; Gravity scan can't be performed here. Naturally, I tried another sensor, and I got the same message. At this point, I sent a probe into orbit to try and get the scans from there, but unfortunately, it doesn't seem to register being over the sites when the probe is actually right on top of them. No entering or exiting message, just... normality.

I'm thinking we have a problem here. Either that or it's just me having the problem. Can you actually hit those sites from orbit? If not, well, the gravity scanners need sorting out.

Just thought I'd say something. I'm probably doing something wrong

Edited December 23, 2014 by RogueMason

Ok, forget it all, I was having a derp moment. You can indeed hit the sites from orbit. That doesn't change the fact that I think atmsopheric flight gravitational measurements should be able to be done.

Other than that, I don't suppose we could all let this just be written off as me being silly?

(Hint: Moderators, your godly services are required )
